title.narrative: Sandy Recovery in Newark and New Jersey

description.narrative: In partnership with A Future With Hope (UMCOR), host construction volunteers in a shared center at Highlands, NJ to assist in the reconstruction/repair of 30 homes in Monmouth County,Partner with Rebuilding Together Jersey Shores and Affordable Housing Alliance of Monmouth County to provide transitional housing for Sandy survivors awaiting repair/reconstruction/elevation of their home,Strengthen and support expansion of parish ministry within Sandy affected communities to support response and recovery capacity through support of mini-grant program,Provide direct assistance to meet the unmet needs of 300-400 individuals referred to the 13 Long-Term Recovery Groups with which the dioceses have partnered. ,In partnership with the Tuckerton Ministerium and A Future With Home (UMCOR) assist in the reconstruction of 30 homes by providing direct and volunteer support serving 120 people and providing volunteer opportunities for 100 others.,In partnership with Atlantic City Long-Term Recovery Group, continue to provide staffing support for Walk-In Assistance Center with Atlantic City, which primarily serves vulnerable populations such as non-English speakers, immigrants, undocumented people and renters,With financial assistance from the American Red Cross, provide direct client assistance for unmet needs in Camden, Cumberland, Gloucester and Salem counties, helping 36 or more households to recover,Support the feeding program at St. Mark's, Keansburg, through staffing and direct funding to meet the needs of 400 people,Support Middlesex County LTRG though funding a part-time outreach coordinator,Pilot Episcopal Relief & Development's asset-maping program to gather and present data on ministry capacities within both dioceses,Work with 15-20 congregations to create preparedness plans,Develop partnership sot provide affordable housing opportunities in New Jersey,Continue collaboration and cooperation with our VOAD partners--Presbyterian Disaster Assistance, UMCOR, Lutheran Disaster Response, Islamic Circle, Jewish Federation, Rebuilding Together, Church World Services, World Renew, Salvation Army, American Red Cross, United Way and others--to coordinate state and regional recovery efforts,Continue advocacy efforts by continuing discussions and collaborations with Federal, State and Local Government agencies. ,Working with diocesan, Episcopal Relief & Development and Episcopal New Service communications staff to continue efforts to "tell the story" of New Jersey's Sandy Recovery,Establish and provide staffing support for a Walk-In Assistance Center in Atlantic City to work with vulnerable populations, particularly renters and immigrants,Reconstruct 30 homes in Tuckerton utilizing volunteer labor,Reconstruct homes in Atlantic City, Atlantic County and Cape May to serve 500 families and provide volunteer opportunities to 150 people,Develop 10 new or expanded parish-based Sandy-recovery programs through a mini-grant program, providing services to affected people, opportunities for servant ministry and congregational transformation.,Pilot Episcopal Relief and Developments asset-mapping program,Continue to develop and train Diocesan Disaster Ministry REgional Coordinators and Workgroups,Develop partnerships and begin planning process to provide affordable housing opportunities in Monmouth County utilizing surplus diocesan-owned property to serve 16-20 families displaced by Sandy.,Continue to support disaster recovery ministries in 11 parishes around the diocese, serving at least 2500 people,Support the feeding program at St. Marks, Keansburg, through staffing and direct funding to meet the needs of 400 people,Work with at least 10 congregations to develop preparedness plans,Working with LTRG in Cumberland County, provide funding and volunteer support to rebuild homes,Provide direct assistance to meet the unmet needs of 150-200 individuals referred to the ten LTRGs

This program will unite the two dioceses in responding to the impacts of Hurricane Sandy throughout the State of New Jersey, through both assistance via the long-term recovery structure and through parish-based programs. The program will also seek to capture lessons learned and leverage Sandy knowledge into long-term preparedness improvements.

description.narrative: Cape May County, United States (admin level 2)
